website_summaries.verdict: The Logitech Ultrathin Keyboard Mini is arguably the best keyboard/case option available for the iPad Mini, but it still doesn't offer a great typing experience.
pros: The Logitech Ultrathin Keyboard Mini is slim, lightweight, and matches up well with the iPad Mini, serving as a screen protector
While small, the keyboard itself has arguably the best layout and design of any iPad Mini keyboard/case
cons: The keyboard is a bit cramped and the case only protects the front of your iPad, not the back

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this keyboard for my iPad mini. The packaging was very nice and it came with a charging cable and a mircofiber cloth. It charged with no difficulty and my entire family likes using it. The one item that I don't like is that it provides no protection for the iPad. It was not advertised as a protective cover. I like the magnetic way that it attaches and also the sturdiness of the keyboard. If it had more protection I would give it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Magnets do not work.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product twice hoping that the magnet feature would work and it doesn't. This is my second refund and it came damaged in the box with no charger. The first time it was missing the static wrap and was missing an instruction manual. I am not quite sure who to blame here, both of these sold as new products were different which means they were resold, repackaged and not checked for whatever reason. I will not be making this same mistake again. This product is worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Kurtus

customer_reviews.title: Save yourself the headache
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after a month. The keys are not accurate - like they've developed an identity disorder - i.e the comma is now a question mark and other keys are doing the same thing, like a virus. I've reached out to Logitech over a week ago and still no response.
customer_reviews.author: Yeti

customer_reviews.title: Useless, doesn't work with iPad Mini, waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I gave this a good try over several days, but it's useless. I tried hard to type things out with this on my iPad Mini, but the characters just kept moving around. And it was so hard to put the cursor on forms, move the cursor, etc. It's very cute and chic, but it's a terrible, useless product. I missed the return window because I was trying so hard to make it work. A waste of $50+.
customer_reviews.author: StardustTop Contributor: Fragrance

customer_reviews.title: I’m a bit disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited for this product because i really wanted to be able to type my class papers on my iPad instead of buying a whole laptop for just that reason. My iPad fits fine and the keyboard works fine, I really like it overall but I there is one MAJOR issue. I tried typing or using the keyboard without charging it and it doesn’t work! I can only use the keyboard while it’s charging. This made me so sad and angry, it’s supposed to be Bluetooth and I can’t even use it without charging it. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: 5 years later it's still working great. The battery charge seems to last forever
customer_reviews.text: Hiked across europe for six months using this with my ipad mini. It took a beating. 2.5 years later it's still working great. The battery charge seems to last forever: I recharge it maybe once a month and type up to an hour a day. It came with a slightly under-sensitive "4" key and that has remained an issue. I just have to hit it a little harder than all the other keys, would have been a 5-star review without this minor quality-control issue. All other keys started off working great and have remained that way. I wish the magnet holding it to the ipad was a bit stronger, sometimes they separate too easily.
customer_reviews.author: Kevvin Sevvin

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit ipad mini 4
customer_reviews.text: The product is a good one - well-made, connects well and has good battery life, BUT the ipad mini 4 doesn't stand well in it. It kind of pokes out at the end. It works well if you don't stand the ipad mini on the keyboard (i.e. prop the ipad mini 4 up with the apple cover and use the keyboard separately), but I guess that's not really the point of this keyboard. I only didn't return it because I got it a while a go and didn't save the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa M.

customer_reviews.title: Turn your ipad mini to laptop (palmtop?)
customer_reviews.text: This one is one of the coolest additions you can have it for your ipad min.. This connects with your iPad Mini via bluetooth and can be activated upon opening, and can be mounted like laptop with keyboard /monitor with around 120-140 degrees. Your ipad can connect to other devices (like iphone--in case if you are tethering for internet) when the keyboard is connected. The keyboard battery lasts for almost two weeks for a single charge. No need to carry an additional charger, though it uses micro-USB. not lightning.
customer_reviews.author: K G

customer_reviews.title: Restocking fee with this supplier
customer_reviews.text: I have used Logitech products in the past before. This one does not keep the iPad mini and the keyboard together. Might be okay if you are sitting at a table, but keeping it in my lap it kept falling apart. Not a problem...I can return it, but they are charging a 15% restocking fee that was a surprise...and not a pleasant one. I will order a different model and hope it is from a different supplier
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit iPad mini 4.
customer_reviews.text: Does not fit the ipad mini 4. That is not adequately disclosed in the description. The ipad mini 4 is slightly wider than the previous iPad minis so it does not fit securely in the slot and falls over when you type.
customer_reviews.author: Ed M

customer_reviews.title: "the" keyboard for iPad
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't see myself considering any other keyboard for my iPad. PRO: -blutooth (easy to setup) -good battery life -has the key reference divets on the 'j' and 'f' keys so you don't have to constantly look down to figure out where your hands are -great for note taking for class (I use the app "Goodnotes") -magnet so it hooks to your iPad -high quality (it is logitech) CON: -the charger isn't the same as the iPad... -the keyboard is a little too small (go figure) for my hands -they keys would prolly leave marks on your screen after awhile (I dont leave mine attached and have a screen protector on my iPad) -some of the keyboard shortcuts aren't intuitive
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Ultrathin Keyboard Cover
customer_reviews.text: I really like this keyboard however keep in mind that it is for an iPad mini so if you have large hands it probably wouldn't be a very practical thing to use. You would be better off just getting a regular sized keyboard with bluetooth capability. I happen to have small hands so this keyboard works just fine for me. I wish the stand on it would allow you to have a back cover on the ipad while you use it. To use this keyboard you cannot have any sort of cover on the back of the iPad mini because the little slot it sits in just isn't big enough. Other than that it is a really great little keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Maylee Beckworth

customer_reviews.title: Not fully functional in IOS 7
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased and soon learned that many thigs do not work with IOS 7. For example,virtually none of the function keys work. Also - the virtual keyboard will not work during and after using the Logitech keyboard, and the only way to get it to function is to turn off Bluetooth and forget the device. There are many other issues documented on the Logitech forums. While some of the problems may not be unique to this keyboard, that does not change the fact that there are major issues with this keyboard. Hopefully Logitech or Apple (really, it will have to be Apple) will fix this soon.
customer_reviews.author: Blodwyn

customer_reviews.title: Defective right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: I received this item in opened box, "like new" condition, literally ten minutes ago. It didn't include a micro-USB charging cable, but I had one of my own, so I plugged it in and tested it. I own an Ipad Mini 2 with Retina, iOS 9. Multiple keys, including the "H," "Q," and "Y" keys simply do not work. Most of the other keys type with little problem, but these problem keys will not register even with a hard press. I'm returning this keyboard as soon as I can.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: A Good Keyboard that Doubles as a Cover for your iPad Mini
customer_reviews.text: The Logitech Ultrathin Keyboard Cover Mini for iPad mini - Black is a simple and easy to use keyboard for your iPad Mini. The magnetics on the keyboard connect well with your iPad Mini and create a great cover for the device. The keyboard is lightweight and does not add a significant amount of weight to the device. The keyboard mirrors a standard keyboard, but is just smaller. The keys are smaller and it takes a little getting used to the keyboard, but once you have mastered it...you can really fly. If you are looking for a keyboard for your iPad Mini and you want it double as an iPad Mini cover, then this keyboard might work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Anthold

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: A great little keyboard for the iPad Mini. It gets four stars instead of five because after six months, it just stopped working. Logitech sent me a replacement under warranty. We'll see how long this one lasts. The keyboard works as you would expect it to. It also serves as a great protective cover for the iPad. When closed, it turns off your screen and the Keyboard sleep mode allows it to work for many weeks on one charge. It's a great bang for the buck. Just keep your receipt handy incase yours stops working too. They will replace it! After using it, I can't imagine not having this keyboard to go with my Mini!
customer_reviews.author: S. Brace

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mini keyboard! It fits perfectly in the sleeve I bought for the iPad. It is smaller, therefore a bit more difficult to type. It takes some getting used to. I use this to type minutes for my meetings and definitely have to charge and practice before each meeting. Logitech items are always amazing! It is lightweight, portable, and it has a sleep/wake function too. Be aware that the keyboard is made like those for Apple products. Being a PC user, it was difficult to understand the commands at first. It does take some getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: It's a great product but I would recommend it because of the cramped size.
customer_reviews.text: Great bluetooth keyboard for your iPad mini. The only problem is, the iPad mini is so small that any keyboard designed to fit the mini will be small and cramped. This one is no different. You can only use the hunt and peck typing method as normal typing will only cause a bunch of errors. The keyboard does prop the iPad mini up at a good angle for viewing. It would probably be better to pair your iPad mini with a bigger full sized bluetooth keyboard and use a stand to prop up your iPad if you expect to do any long typing.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Well made for serious travel usage
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this slim little metal (I think) keyboard several months ago to travel abroad with newly acquired ipad. Definitely a good purchase! Note that it doesn't accommodate the ipad in the slot provided because I use a heavy duty screen protector. However, my little foldable Anker stand makes it all work together just fine. I'm wordy and the onscreen keyboard was ok for quick notes/messages on the run, but just not handy for lengthier writing. Had to get used to the Logitech small size, but it works great (on table/desk, not lap), nice 'click' response, allows for easy manipulation of the cursor and other stuff that I haven't yet figured out. Good instructions,
customer_reviews.author: khamster

customer_reviews.title: "Cover" is a misleading description
customer_reviews.text: Few things to consider about this keyboard. First, don't expect to type as comfortable and predictable as your regular laptop keyboard. Since this is a small size, designers had to reduce sizing and space between keys to make this functional. As a result, you will mistype frequently and will get some time to get used to. Another problem is the tab function which is essentially a 2-key pressing function. However, the worst part of this keyboard is the inability to securely close the iPad when keyboard is not in use, this should not be called a cover as this is misleading... I was certainly not expecting this.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel T

customer_reviews.title: Good in a pinch, doesn't stay closed, cramped quote and semicolon keys.
customer_reviews.text: While this functions okay as a keyboard--a little cramped, but that's to be expected--it doesn't fit well with the iPad Mini itself. Specifically, it doesn't stay securely closed when folded up, and it falls off if you try to swing it out of the way. So you're stuck worrying about your ipad falling open or falling apart when carrying it. The keyboard also ends up so close to the screen that you can easily brush against the screen while typing, moving your cursor or worse. Also, the A key is way bigger than it needs to be while the ; and ' keys get short shrift. Seems like a better placement of ' at least would be helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Feinman

customer_reviews.title: Caps Lock very broken on this product
customer_reviews.text: While this is a neat little toy in theory, there is something very broken with the Caps Lock on this product. It often reverts into caps lock mode for no apparent reason and once it does that it is extremely difficult to get out of it. I've read up on some possible solutions but none have helped. If I don't manage to find a reasonable fix, I will be returning this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you want to write on the ipad mini this is the keyboard, no question.
customer_reviews.text: The best keyboard cover out there. I love the placement of the keys and the focus on mimicking a real keyboard instead of a trying to cram everything into special function keys. Makes it actually usable for note taking and creative writing. Battery life is also fantastic, easily able to get 2-3 months of life with a single charge since it turns off automatically and wakes and reconnects with only a few hitches in that time.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Provenzano

customer_reviews.title: Great kit, but handle with care!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard allows my iPad ALMOST to replace my laptop. l will shortly be installing the MS Office app, and I hope then to be able to travel without the laptop. I anticipate that I will soon have an iPad that can really do it all. My only quibble is that the magnetic attachment will not take the weight of the iPad and, if one is not careful picking it up, the iPad comes crashing off the keyboard/cover - or vice versa. Handled with the care it deserves, it's a great piece of kit.
customer_reviews.author: James Arbuckle

customer_reviews.title: Such a Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous reading the reviews, but finally bullet and bought one. Super glad I did! Despite the limited space Logitech had to work with, they turned out a great keyboard layout. Very few errors getting used to the layout. Fine quality almost comparable to the iPad itself! Magnet is strong and the screen sleep works as expected. The Logitech has little pads, so u don't necessarily have to worry about scratching it's back while typing on a hard service. One slight issue: The iPad sits slightly more vertical than the pics seem to show. Far from a deal breaker, however.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy S

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: Feels like a regular keyboard. I can type quickly and well. I've recently upgraded to the mini ipad 4 so unfortunately, this keyboard is no longer an exact fit but it's still better than the other keyboard I tried. This one isn't cheap but worth the money when compared with cheaper versions. I type a lot so I need a substantial yet lightweight product.
customer_reviews.author: Professional Psychic

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice keyboard that could easily save you when you need to do some work and you are out w/o your Mac. The only problem is that because of its size it could be a little annoying to type fast specially if you have big fingers. Believe it or not, I use it mostly as a cover and as a stand (for vertical and horizontal). I don't usually turn it on but it's there whenever I want to use it. Just for the fact of being a nice cover and amazing stand this is absolutely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto Barron

customer_reviews.title: Yes!  An Ideal low cost companion to the iPad.
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with my Logitech Ultrathin Keyboard. There are others that are more sophisticated but most turn the iPad into a computer and are bulky. Ultrathin is a true statement. It works as described, makes using the iPad much easier when working on documents, responding to emails and also serves as a holder for viewing movies when stuck on a long plane trip. When not in use it fits perfectly in a USPS Express Mail envelop. It can be found for much less now and the refurb are less still...
customer_reviews.author: rowca

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: it is little - for a mini iPad, so don't let the complaints about little keys upset you. They have to be little. The key action is great, the magnetic strip holds the iPad on, and holds its charge forever. It's a great little work horse. Had a hiccup during an OS upgrade for a bit, but got that sorted and am on my way again. My husband says his boss and other senior execs have transferred most of their work to it. (Not sure how much that says about their work, or the keyboard, but take it for what you will.)
customer_reviews.author: Housewares snob

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard, small but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is going to take getting used to, do to size, space, and layout of the keys, but that should be expected when you're looking for something small and light like the iPads they are compatible with. I really like the magnetic bar that connects the iPad to the keyboard. It works like a mini laptop! There was no damage to the keyboard when I received it in the mail, and the instructions were easy to follow. I'm actually using the keyboard right now to type this review. I have small fingers, so the small keys and crapped space, isn't an issue for me. If you have big hands, or fingers, this may not be the keyboard for you.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi

customer_reviews.title: BEST iPad mini keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to use, especially with the special keyboard layout. I was worried when purchasing whether the iPad would stand securely in the upright 'slot' while typing and I ordered another viewing stand just in case, however the slot is magnetized (like the hinge) so that the iPad is held snug at a perfect viewing angle! I am recommending this case to everyone I know w/ an iPad mini. It also looks/feels great when it's on and closed, exactly like it was meant to come with the device originally.
customer_reviews.author: BMV

customer_reviews.title: This is a tiny keyboard for a tiny computer. ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a tiny keyboard for a tiny computer. It connects magnetically, and folds into a compact package. There are two compromises: Because it is so small, the keys are scrunched together. This is not a flaw, just the nature of the beast. But accuracy suffers. Also, it does not provide any protection. If you drop it, everything is exposed. I have purchased a cheap neoprene case to keep everything in.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Bernstein

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and Easily Portable
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a keyboard cover that would allow me to use my iPad with a keyboard even away from my office, and this is it. Granted, it won't provide any protection for my iPad whatsoever, but the design is pretty freaking fantastic. The case attaches via magnet on one side of the iPad mini, which slides handily into the slot when you want it to stand up. The incline the slot provides is just right for viewing, and I have never had any problems with my iPad mini falling out, except because of my own idiocy.
customer_reviews.author: Melia

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product
customer_reviews.text: Good quality product. Easy to use. The keys are responsive, adequately sized, and adequately spaced for touch typing. Magnetic adhesion to the smooth edge of the mini is adequate. Almost three months and I'm still on the first charge. One minor issue is that the glass screen protector on my mini adds just enough extra width to the profile that positioning of the mini within the groove meant to hold the mini in place while typing becomes unreliable, especially in the less-upright position. Be aware of this limitation when choosing a screen protector--a film screen protector would likely prove more effective. Overall, I'm quite pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Sassone

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, I was looking for a Keyboard which I could work with. I take it to work and it's very practical. Really good bluetooth conectivity, if you have your iPad bluetooth on, it connects instantly. Hard keys, smooth typing. The only thing I dont find it practical is that you can not use a cover if you want to use it properly, it works better with a sleeve case.You can also use cover, but separate from the keyboard. Be aware to not but it in your purse ladies, it gets scratch easily in the back.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: While I still use the on screen keyboard, it's nice to have the option to use the logitech keyboard, especially if I have a lot of typing to do. It's like having a teeny tiny laptop I can carry in my purse. Plus, the cover is very substantial and I feel it protects my keyboard much better than the ipad cover apple makes.when you compare the prices of the 2 this is a better value and more functional. Would definitely recommend. It was shipped quickly and well packaged. I just don't think you can go wrong with this.
customer_reviews.author: Quiltobsession

customer_reviews.title: A waste of money for those who do serious typing.
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the spend. The tiny gum piece keys are impossible to navigate, and in the end, I found myself not using this keyboard at all. I wouldn't recommend this keyboard for anyone who is used to a regular sized one, and needs that kind of convenience. Don't make this switch if you do intensive keyboarding because it won't be able to keep up. The bluetooth is nice, but that's all it has going for it. Not worth the spend at all.
customer_reviews.author: Techguru

customer_reviews.title: This was a huge disappointment! The battery is faulty
customer_reviews.text: This was a huge disappointment! The battery is faulty, it will not connect to blue tooth unless it's plugged in, yet the battery light is on stead indicating it's fully charged! Took me quite a while to figure this out, very frustrating! I hope the seller ENV will process return with no problem!
customer_reviews.author: Discerning Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good for what it is.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is very difficult to accurately type on, but that is more of a result of its diminutive size as opposed to its function or performance. This keyboard is sufficient to type out a quick email, but do not expect to be able to draft lengthy documents with ease. One gripe I have is that you cannot use the up and down arrows to scroll through emails on an iPad mini. Instead, you have to use your finger and touch-screen.
customer_reviews.author: J.I.

customer_reviews.title: Will not buy used again.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift. It does not work without the charger. The battery does not hold a charge.
customer_reviews.author: Miaesha Blackwell

customer_reviews.title: Solid But...
customer_reviews.text: Liked everything about this, but one major thing...the screen doesn't push back at far enough an angle. I have to stoop over just to easily read the screen. If I were able to tilt the screen back to a position where I can sit properly at a desk and type I'd give it 5 stars. And yes, this works best on a hard surface. Its flimsy if you try and have on lap. So the connectivity, bluetooth connection, battery life are all solid so far. But my usage is probably going to drop because of angle issue at which the screen sits.
customer_reviews.author: L. Granozio

customer_reviews.title: The battery goes a long way
customer_reviews.text: The battery on this thing is truly amazing. I'm a student, and I constantly use my iPad for taking notes. This is such a great buy! This is truly the other half of the iPad mini, the packaging is very cute. Keep in mind that this is for the iPad mini, therefore this is very small, don't expect to get a regular-sized keyboard. Be prepared to type on a small keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great little keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little keyboard! It's just what I wanted to protect my iPad Mini and have a way to type. It's also good for standing up the mini for reading. I bought the Mini for travel and this keyboard is light enough that it doesn't add to the weight. It finds the iPad as soon as I turn it on and is very easy to operate. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Bosco

customer_reviews.title: companion to the iPad mini
customer_reviews.text: iI received an iPad mini for Christmas and found that I missed the "laptop" feel, although I do enjoy the mini. I did some research on-line and in stores and chose the Logitech ultrathin keyboard because it is sturdy yet thin and fairly light. I can place the mini in portrait or landscape in the holder, but have ony typed while in the landscape mode. I like that I get the same "keyboard click" when I type because I am old school and am used to it. Fits into my purse easily and has turned my iPad mini into a laptop!
customer_reviews.author: SunnyLorraine

customer_reviews.title: A great small keyboard for your iPad mini
customer_reviews.text: A great small keyboard for your iPad mini. It's lightweight and folds over your mini like a case. The only downside is the learning curve when it comes to typing on it. I made a lot of typos the first day, but once I slowed down a bit, everything was fine. After using it for a couple days, it's not a problem at all.
customer_reviews.author: CSWong

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Tech!
customer_reviews.text: I am generally satisfied with the overall performance of this keyboard for my iPad mini, but I have long skinny fingers that stumble around with its smaller size. And the keyboard does not have a back-light. On the plus side the battery life is excellent, and the overall design is very well done and lightweight. The "groove" that holds the devices maintains a steady secure hold which is a nice design feature on a plane. The Bluetooth functions without any issues what-so-ever -- just turn it on!
customer_reviews.author: Shopping Mama's

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for on-the-go writing
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty pleased with this little thing. I'm an author and often write on the go. I use this with Evernote on my iPad and type away while my kids are at appointments. The keys are a little smaller than I'm used to and I often mistype, but whatever. It's faster than the on screen keyboard. I always need to remind myself to turn the keyboard off when I'm done with it to save the battery. I wish it powered off on its own sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: I-Love-To-Read

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Keyboards for the iPad Mini are obviously smaller than the full sized iPads, but this Logitech keyboard cover for iPad Mini works well considering its small footprint. The key layout is easy to grasp, and my typing speeds are good despite the reduced size. The keys have good travel and don't make too much noise (it's quieter than the first gen Logitech Keyboard Cover for the iPad with retina display). Note: The keyboard stand feature does not work if you have a back cover on the iPad.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: I loved carrying my iPad mini with me everywhere and I ...
customer_reviews.text: I loved carrying my iPad mini with me everywhere and I was looking for ways to replace my macbook with my iPad in terms of saving space. If you're like me and have a difficulty typing quickly on the iPad mini, this keyboard was a lifesaver. At first, it was hard adjusting to the small size but after several uses you will get use to it. I love that it has a magnetic connecter that allows it to attach to your iPad when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: AKD

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: It seems a tad flimsy in my hands, but this little thing has worked perfectly, even as I have dragged it hither and yon cross-country, usually snapped to my iPad mini and jammed in my purse. The battery life is excellent. Sometimes I have to reboot the Bluetooth connection. I expect people with larger hands will find its tiny size a challenge, but I also expect that's unavoidable for anything built to function with an iPad mini.
customer_reviews.author: Eos

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Grand daughter's iPad mini. She is 10 years old and is ecstatic about it. Easy to use, charge and snaps in perfectly. The white matches her mini perfectly and feels and like it is all one unit integrated together. The keyboard has good tacktal feel. Previous she used a Belden folio cover to protect mini from dropping. It would be nice someone would make that type of cover to fit over iPad mini with keyboard snapped and closed in place to protect against drops.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: It doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: It doesnt work if its unplugged. I charged the battery all night but when I unpluged it, it goes off and doesnt work. I tried with different cable usb and its the same
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I was recommended this keyboard by a techie guy at an electronics store and found in on here for a better price. I have only had to charge it once so far and I use it daily for about ~6 hours of use in class (I have had it for about 4 months). It doubles as a magnetic cover which is great for throwing into the backpack. It does take some getting used to at first since it is so small so it might not be suitable for people with larger hands. The size is great, but the compromise is different key locations for special functions, but everything is doable once you get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: KelseyO89

customer_reviews.title: Useless keyboard .. great in the past. Maybe the seller is at fault.
customer_reviews.text: I received my keyboard with no charging cable and no instruction. Since I had an old keyboard, I tried to charge it with the old cable. When plugged in, it worked. When using Bluetooth (as it is supposed to use), it has not worked at all. Very disappointed and will be moving on to a different keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: rft

customer_reviews.title: It works wonderfully with her mini iPad
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mini keypad for my daughter for christmas. It works wonderfully with her mini iPad, easy to travel with too. She uses it everyday and we have not had any issues with it. My husband is a writer and borrowed her iPad and keyboard and he thought it was comfortable and easy to use. Between us I am going to purchase one for my husband for his iPad :)
customer_reviews.author: Shoegirl

customer_reviews.title: Won’t Hold Charge
customer_reviews.text: This doesn’t hold a charge. It has to be plugged in and that’s super not cool or useful.
customer_reviews.author: Teesha

customer_reviews.title: Great accessory!
customer_reviews.text: Works relatively well, though Blue Tooth syncing seems to be a bit slow when first turned on/when iPad is first brought out of standby mode. Keyboard has a ton of shortcut buttons that let's you access virtually any iPad feature from key combinations, which is nice. Due to size restraints, some key positions take a little getting used to and becoming fluent with key combinations takes some practice. That said, this is a must have accessory for me. I've been using for about half a year, experienced no functional faults, battery issues, Blue Tooth issues, etc.
customer_reviews.author: C. Woodford

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, cute packaging
customer_reviews.text: If you write/type a lot on an iPad Mini, this is a great keyboard. Set up is very easy. It integrates well to the iPad Mini. It's designed to hold iPad Mini in landscape (horizontal) configuration, but works in portrait (vertical), too. It can hold the iPad Mini in one angle only, but it's not a bad angle. The packaging is cute (drawer-in-drawer design), too - it shows that some thinking went into its design.
customer_reviews.author: Lan Acane

customer_reviews.title: About as good as it gets with this size.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for short typing and it works well for that. The layout is modified from the standard, so be prepared to make some mistakes if you are a touch typist. But for short emails and messages this works well. The battery lasts a long time and it works well as a stand. I do wish it had multiple angles for the stand position though. Overall I think it is the best keyboard for the Mini if you want something that can fit in the same case without adding much extra bulk.
customer_reviews.author: iDevGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking that I'd use it all the time, I don't. It has it's "time to use" moments, if I'm taking notes at a meeting it's great, or composing emails also great. If I'm working on something in pages it's great too. But for the everyday use of surfing the web and similar things like that I prefer to hold the iPad mini. Again it's a good well built product that does what it says and has a useful place, you have to find your own needs for it.
customer_reviews.author: SteveO60

customer_reviews.title: lifesaver for a frequent traveler
customer_reviews.text: Makes work during frequent air travel much easier. If I have the misfortune to sit behind someone who reclines, I can't open my laptop far enough to see the screen. Now I just pull out my iPad mini and Logitech keyboard and work there instead. It also works as a stand if I want to watch a movie rather than work. It is fairly lightweight and I have been using it for a month with no need to recharge.
customer_reviews.author: Kimncris

customer_reviews.title: the design is to hold the iPad in the groove with magnetic - which is great as long as you keep the iPad in landscape ...
customer_reviews.text: It is small but it's expected.. I have no problem with it. The keys are responsive and the keyboard is light & stylish.. the design is to hold the iPad in the groove with magnetic - which is great as long as you keep the iPad in landscape mode... BUT it won't hold your iPad in portrait mode ( I try to use it while reading a book in Kindle ).. iPad become too top heavy and tip over all the time...
customer_reviews.author: WM

customer_reviews.title: Tiny, but works well
customer_reviews.text: This cover works about as well as it possibly could, considering the size of the iPad mini. I have fat, stupid fingers, and so I'm constantly hitting the wrong key, but your milage may vary. Despite this it's clearly well constructed and holds a charge very well. I end up using this as a stand more often than a keyboard. The only gripe I have is that the A key is the same shape as the Caps Lock (since it can function as one). My pinky is very well trained not to hit that longer key, and so I usually end up shifted over one key and not realizing it. I'll probably get used to it, but it's very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Hans Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great Mini Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I gave this product a five star it might not be a real keyboard but it works for me speacially if I am waiting at the airport or at starbucks or at home , what I dislike is that I cant seem to figure out the arrow buttons that are up and down can you use them while surfing the internet ? I tried using them yes I did read the manual to, overall I like this mini keyboard and you should buy it, it fits perfect for my little hands as well and matches my white i pad mini well .
customer_reviews.author: Traveler84

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Keeps disconnecting when my iPad mini is inactive for a couple minutes, then I'd have to sometimes turn it off, then back on to reconnect through my bluetooth. Battery life is very good, and lasts a very long time. I used it for 3-5+ hours every Monday-Thursday for note taking in class. Bit small, but I got accustomed to it after some time.
customer_reviews.author: Christine H

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard case
customer_reviews.text: Really like this keyboard - it's thin and light. In addition, it has the apostrophes in the right place unlike other keyboard cases! Added plus is that if you move the magnetic clip, it'll hold the ipad in place on top of the keyboard so that you can use it in tablet mode. Only gripe is that the ipad rests pretty upright, which is made even steeper if you have it on your lap. You have to put the iPad farther away in those situations.
customer_reviews.author: Yellow

customer_reviews.title: Perfect keyboard for the mini iPad
customer_reviews.text: I have this keyboard for my mini iPad and my husband fell in love with it so I bought it for him for Christmas. It so nice to have the magnetic connection to the mini and also that it provides a perfect stand. I carry the keyboard, smart cover, and mini together in a small pouch, which is perfect for travel because I can still use the mini with the smart cover for watching movies or reading but easily access the keyboard when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: It will change the way you use your IPAD mini
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an IPAD mini and was so confused on how I should use it. It was not comfortable enough to substitute out my laptop and for smaller things i had my Iphone. After I purchased this keyboard it definitely changed the way I use my IPAD. It makes typing so easy and so increases the functionality of your ipad. It is also VERY high quality and great price. It makes my IPAD mini look 100x better!
customer_reviews.author: OutLook

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: The only but I could see in it is that now I might have to buy a case to avoid the scratches in the ipads back and case. Appart from that is quite simple and useful.
customer_reviews.author: mearceos

customer_reviews.title: Turns my ipad into a laptop
customer_reviews.text: The Logitech Ultrathin Keyboard cover works perfectly. It charged up and connected through bluetooth seamlessly. It makes a great stand for the ipad in both orientations, and magnetically connects as a hard cover to neatly and safely store. The mini keyboard takes a little getting used to due to its smaller size (than a regular ipad keyboard), but it's way better than typing on the screen keyboard. I wish it had a few more functions, like page up and down, but other than that it's a great accessory, and I use it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Ocean Junkie

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard types great. However
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard types great. However, I am not a huge fan of the angle the iPad has to be at–it is basically standing straight up when you type. Also, the magnetic strip that holds the iPad is not very strong, and the iPad can very easily fall off if you make any sudden movement with it. Despite those complaints, I'm still using this keyboard for school and it hasn't crapped out on me yet like my last one did.
customer_reviews.author: Madison H.

customer_reviews.title: Makes using the ipad so much easier
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little keyboard. It holds the ipad upright so you're basically functioning with this keyboard like you would with a full fledged computer. You can take it with you and leave at will which offers so much more flexibility with the device. Has a great keyboard action and I love that you don't have to sacrifice 1/2 of your ipad screen to type. The only downfall is it could use a case of some sort to keep it clean and dust free when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: T. Corinne

customer_reviews.title: Freaking SMART!
customer_reviews.text: iPad mini is a great device. I actually like it better than my full size iPad tablet. I am fortunate that we have integrated our work messaging and corporate systems into this platform. I almost never travel with my laptop any longer, so having a better typing method was a no brainer. This simple and effective device is a great win-win with the ability to protect and multitask as a stand and a keyboard. Blue-tooth pairing took maybe 5 seconds. Thanks Logitech!
customer_reviews.author: USERBOSCO

customer_reviews.title: Too small for large hands
customer_reviews.text: I have somewhat large hands so this addition to my iPad Mini didn't work as well as I wanted. Since I was working with a Mini, the width was just too narrow for being able to easily type. Other functionality was nice but I couldn't easily see what I was doing if I was using both hands. It's unfortunate because I think this is otherwise a sturdy product. If you have small hands or perhaps order this product for a larger iPad, I'd suggest making this Logitech purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Orki

customer_reviews.title: and wanted to like it. The iPad MINI wasn't held reliably in ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried using this, and wanted to like it. The iPad MINI wasn't held reliably in place when standing up, and it didn't stay on magnetically very well. Eventually I gave up and my 2 year old uses this to pretend type and I bought the Microsoft Universal Bluetooth keyboard, which is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: hellimedic

customer_reviews.title: This is a very useful addition to the iPad Mini
customer_reviews.text: This is a very useful addition to the iPad Mini. It adds little additional weight or size as compared with the standard folding cover, provides a full function keyboard and holds the iPad Mini at a good angle for use. Touch typists may find the small size of the keyboard a little difficult to get used to (and there are a few unusual key combinations), but it was more important to me to have a keyboard that matches the iPad Mini's small footprint.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Sadly, I had to return
customer_reviews.text: Great product and just what I wanted; sadly, I had to return. I'd purchased the keyboard in conjunction with an Aidata iPad mini Stand (back side mount); however, the space between the plastic cover was not wide enough to accomodate the connecting keyboard magnet. While this configuration works well for the full size iPad - it does not for the mini. I elected to keep the cover and go without the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Gaddis

customer_reviews.title: There are Much better choices
customer_reviews.text: Mine wouldn't connect every time, but main complaint is the unstable position when the pad is engaged with the keyboard (it flops around and falls off it tilted). Also the on-off switch and connect button are impossible to use without visual location (tiny little things on the side) making it impossible to use in the dark. I like Logitech products. They can do better than this.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Good for trips when keyboard isn't always needed.
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine and if this type of keyboard is what you are used to, I imagine it is five stars. However I think the full cover with integrated keyboard by Logitech is much better. I bought this one for trips when it doesn't always need to be connected, but I am not that fond of it. The quality is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Linda R. Belair

customer_reviews.title: Looks like I'm stuck with it
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard cover I received malfunctions when you hit the "e". A 3 pops up most of the time. I thought it maybe just a stuck key, but no it still does its thing. I finally gave up and decided to return the keyboard cover but return time ran out Jan.31,2016. Looks like I'm stuck with it. The design is great and I would order another, but would return immediately if a problem occurred, not try to solve it myself.
customer_reviews.author: C. Blanchard

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It is a great keyboard. It always works, very responsive, battery lasts for weeks. And despite its size, it is a confortable device. The only thing I don't like too much is the angle in which the iPad sets. It feels a little awkward when not sitting in a desk. I hope that the next iOS version has more keyboard support than the current one (8.4)
customer_reviews.author: Dissapointed Customer

customer_reviews.title: Syncs easily and attaches to iPad well
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an iPad keyboard that has the apostrophe key in a convenient location (by right pinky not a random button next to space bar). Met all my needs. Syncs easily and attaches to iPad well, both with magnet as a cover and as a stand (iPad has thin screen protector plus vinyl skin on the back). I'm still getting used to the small keys but am sure I'll get used to it over time.
customer_reviews.author: Toshi

customer_reviews.title: but doesn't hold the pad up as securely as we would like.
customer_reviews.text: Works well for the typing, but doesn't hold the pad up as securely as we would like.
customer_reviews.author: Mobile Man

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, small but need be better
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard it is really well, but something don't work very well as accentuation (I write many words in Portuguese, but the accentuation does't work), other aspect is when I close it iPad does't turnoff automatically, so this spend a little more battery that is necessary, and finally to protect both (keyboard and iPad) need a case, so I need buy another accessory to reach all my requirements. I recommend this but with caveats.
customer_reviews.author: Wlamir Marques Sobrinho

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I had the same Logitech keyboard for my Ipad 3, and once I saw this was available for the mini, I bought it right away. You can waste a lot of time and money using sub-par covers and stands. This is by far the best on the market and worth the extra money. It acts as a cover and attaches with a magnetic snap and close, when open, it pops into place. Once you've adjusted to the smaller keyboard, the keys themselves are responsive and better than others I've tried - very close in feel to the keys of a MacBook Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Randall S Kish

customer_reviews.title: Keys falling off after a couple years
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a few years, but the keys are falling off now. Would have thought it would have held up better because of the brand.
customer_reviews.author: B.E.

customer_reviews.title: Would not run out to buy...
customer_reviews.text: After getting the keyboard and keeping it for a day, I sent it back. It might just be my preference, but I found the small keyboard VERY difficult to type on. I figured if I wanted to type something SO BAD that I would need a keyboard, I would just use my laptop. If you use the iPad Mini for your main computer, I would get it, but the keyboard is VERY small and annoying to use.
customer_reviews.author: Nmarie

customer_reviews.title: Charge the keyboard once and the battery works forever!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard has super human powers. It never needs to be recharged. I can't figure it out. I don't get it. This keyboard works and works and works. I bought this one to go with my mini ipad after I upgraded from my regular ipad. My old (larger) ipad has the keyboard and I've never recharged it in well over 30 months. This new one seems to be working as well. I love Logitech!
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: good construction, but key positions awkward
customer_reviews.text: First off, my lukewarm review is not really the fault of the product. I'm thinking that maybe it's impossible to create an iPad mini keyboard that is really comfortable or fast to write on-- there's just not enough space. It is really well made, and looks great. The metal finish matches the iPad very well, and the keyboard action is very good. The one thing that I couldn't get used to was the way the keys are shifted to the left, so that my hands feel off center in relation to the iPad screen.
customer_reviews.author: yanakasanpo

customer_reviews.title: As awesome as its big brother.
customer_reviews.text: I had the large version of this keyboard for my Ipad and when getting a mini knew that Logitech would be my choice for keyboard/cover. Works great, the size takes some getting used to be it is what it is, can't be bigger than the Mini itself so you get what you get which is a great little keyboard that beats the crap out of typing on screen and what's best it finds and pairs with it pretty seamlessly. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Drweb

customer_reviews.title: which is great! I also like how small and lightweight it ...
customer_reviews.text: The battery lasts for a loooooooong time, which is great! I also like how small and lightweight it is. The only thing I would change is adding the capability to change what angle your iPad mini sits at when in the groove. It would be nice to be able to tilt it, depending where the iPad and keyboard are sitting (on a table, on my lap, etc).
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Nice but tight
customer_reviews.text: Works well, doesn't have to be physically attached to the ipad which is nice 'cause I like to prop the ipad up on the coffee table and have the keyboard on my lap. But keep in mind, if you have big bear hands like me it's going to take a while to get used to it--it's small and tight and you'll feel like you're teaching your fingers to do ballet.
customer_reviews.author: mrblister

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Takes a while to get used to because it is smaller than a normal keyboard....but even if I peck at it, it is better than using the keyboard on the screen. I like the fact that it is removal so I can play games on my Ipad .....my only regret is that I didnt purchase it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Agnes Shapiro

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. Easy to carry around. Easy to remove the ipad mini retina for reading and internet use without a keyboard. This replaces my laptop completely when traveling and I don't have many documents to create and just need access to emails and short documents. Again love this, easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A. Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Mostly love with a little bit of annoyance
customer_reviews.text: Love that I don't have to constantly use the function key for the apostrophe (') and question mark (?). I've had to do that with another keyboard and it drove me nuts. The only other thing I would change is the ability to fold the ipad all the way over to hold/ as a tablet. Love it otherwise
customer_reviews.author: CWoodClimb

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations: long battery life and very useful
customer_reviews.text: I had a keyboard for my original iPad and was not impressed. In fact, I never used it after the first attempt. This product is a far cry from early efforts. It's small, but completely usable (although a couple of key placement decisions are sub optimal). I love the no-multitasking nature of the device for taking notes and focusing on writing. Good value and good product.
customer_reviews.author: telebob

customer_reviews.title: I actually purchased this as a gift for someone. ...
customer_reviews.text: I actually purchased this as a gift for someone. I never really thought I'd use one, but I borrowed it one time and never gave it back. Really convenient on a plane, or just in any cramped space where you might need to type efficiently and you don't want to bring your laptop along.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: A great little mini keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Very well built and solid; works great. The hinge does not lock and is not intended to support the screen in an angled position -- this seems odd and unfortunate. Placing the screen into the slot above the keyboard works fine, but there's some chance of it falling out if you have it on your lap.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Knauss

customer_reviews.title: The keyboard works GREAT with the ipad
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard works GREAT with the ipad, but the groove to hold up the iPad doesn't appear to be that sturdy. My ipad has already fallen backwards at least 5 times while in use. I'm now looking for a stand to help support my ipad as I spent a lot of time examining and researching different keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Faircloth

customer_reviews.title: perfect keyboard but added protection needed
customer_reviews.text: I used to use the black keyboard by shark before, and my experience was not a good one. Few of its keys began to not work within 1-2 months. This one has a better design, and all the keys are working fine so far (it's been few weeks). It is sturdy and the magnetic attachment is superb. It pairs up nicely with my ipad mini via bluetooth in few seconds. The keyboard input is very nice and responsive, too. The only downside is the lack of protection. I cannot use an additional case because of the magnetic attachment. Overall, other than the lack of protection, this keyboard is a perfect one for everyday use with a beautiful and convenient design.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer You
